channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 大流行病在英国引发了 XL Bully 的繁殖狂潮后，它们的数量激增。它们的祖先有助于解释它们的攻击性👇。
item.description:
After the pandemic sparked an XL Bully breeding frenzy in Britain, their population exploded. So did the number of attacks.

Their ancestry helps explain their aggression https://t.co/TEPLxcQ7Yx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 今天的 "情报 "节目：美联储对美国经济的小心翼翼、沃达丰的瘦身计划以及保护英国历史建筑的复杂官僚体系。收听每日播客： 👇
item.description:
Today on “The Intelligence”: the Fed’s careful treading on America’s economy, Vodafone’s slimming plan and the knotty bureaucracy of preserving Britain’s historic buildings. Listen to the daily podcast: https://t.co/NwNpA3VBEy 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 米非司酮药片使许多妇女能够在家中进行人工流产。米非司酮药片安全有效，占美国终止妊娠的近三分之二。但有些人却希望最高法院取缔它们。从医学和法律上讲，这都是一个错误。
item.description:
Mifepristone pills enable many women to have home abortions. They are safe, effective, and account for nearly two-thirds of terminations in America. Yet some want the Supreme Court to clamp down on them.

Medically—and legally—that would be an error https://t.co/1bhUyRYipK 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 米非司酮药片使许多妇女能够在家中进行人工流产。米非司酮药片安全有效，占美国终止妊娠的近三分之二。但有些人却希望最高法院取缔它们。从医学和法律上讲，这都是一个错误。
item.description:
Mifepristone pills enable many women to have home abortions. They are safe, effective, and account for nearly two-thirds of terminations in America. Yet some want the Supreme Court to clamp down on them.

Medically—and legally—that would be an error https://t.co/AoP4nEGElx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 在今天开始的欧盟领导人峰会上，将有很多关于欧洲坚定支持的声音，但几乎没有其他内容👇。
item.description:
The summit of EU leaders which has begun today will feature plenty of sound-bites on Europe’s unwavering support, but little else https://t.co/cRr5LJ2b3i 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 新研究表明，人工智能生成的角球战术与人类建议的角球战术一样出色。
item.description:
AI-generated tactics on corner kicks are just as good as those suggested by humans, new research suggests.

Football coaches should pay attention: https://t.co/Sv5id2pyQz ⚽

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 根据一项联合调查，自 2013 年以来，对韩国持积极看法的日本人首次多于持消极看法的人。
item.description:
For the first time since 2013, more Japanese people had positive views of South Korea than had negative ones according to a joint survey.

Yet much wariness remains https://t.co/jAP7yzqYDG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 一名蓝领卡车司机如何卷入美国最致命的人口走私案之一詹姆斯-布拉德利（James Bradley）当了 46 年的卡车司机，后来有人向他提出了一份诱人的工作。但事情却发生了致命的转变 帕特里克-斯文森
item.description:
How a blue-collar trucker got involved in one of America’s deadliest people-smuggling cases

James Bradley had been a truck driver for 46 years before he was approached with an enticing offer. But things took a deadly turn https://t.co/ysNcybxH3A

Illustrations: Patrik Svensson

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 物价压力的缓慢缓解和美国经济的持续活力，引发了关于美联储是否可能制定更激进路线的争论。
item.description:
The slow easing of price pressures and America’s continued economic vigour have fuelled debate about whether the Federal Reserve might chart a more aggressive course.

But the central bank has stuck to its plans, despite an uncertain situation https://t.co/mIkoH379pm 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 印度日益加剧的南北鸿沟可能会毁掉这个国家--或使其 👇。
item.description:
India’s growing north-­south divide could ruin the country—or make it https://t.co/KHsYEi4S6J 👇

item.title: 反对米非司酮的理由在法律和医学上都是虚假的。我们的 @《经济学人》领导者将于下周在美国国会众议院讨论多布斯案以来的第一起堕胎案
item.description:
The case against mifepristone is legally and medically spurious. Our @TheEconomist leader on the first abortion case since Dobbs coming to SCOTUS next week https://t.co/rx1w6gY4lR

— Steven Mazie (@stevenmazie) March 20, 2024

item.title: 第 23 条涵盖叛国、叛乱、煽动叛乱和间谍等罪行。它与中央政府 2020 年强加给香港的安全法重叠。但最新的措施有新的令人担忧的内容👇。
item.description:
Article 23 covers offences such as treason, insurrection, sedition and espionage. It overlaps with a security law imposed on Hong Kong by the central government in 2020.

But the latest measure has new and worrying elements https://t.co/kJNj8mA26S 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 想更好地了解英国作为移民国家的角色？雷丁镇--从学校、医院到杂货店--是了解这一多元化成功故事的窗口 👇
item.description:
Want to better understand Britain’s role as a nation of immigrants? The town of Reading—from schools to hospitals to grocery shops—is a window into this diversity success story https://t.co/RZnEkdF9O8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 经济学人》希望了解 2024 年的符拉迪沃斯托克。因此，我们花了大量时间分析公开信息、计算数字并与居民交谈。请跟随我们的脚步，从人到地方，了解这座城市的构成： 👇
item.description:
The Economist wanted to get to know the Vladivostok of 2024. So we spent time analysing open-source information, crunching numbers and speaking to residents.

Follow the journey we took to find out what makes the city, from its people to its places: https://t.co/2syVJmQmgm 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 日本很难说繁荣--消费疲软，增长乏力。但日本不再需要一整套旨在提高通胀的政策👇。
item.description:
Japan is hardly booming—consumption is weak and growth is anaemic. But the country no longer requires an entire armoury of policies designed to raise inflation https://t.co/RevKbftod6 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 寻找下一本读物？这九本近期出版的历史类图书是该类型图书中的佼佼者👇。
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: 弗拉基米尔-普京的大炮发射的炮弹数量约为乌克兰的五倍。但俄罗斯是否有足够的火炮来保持这种势头？ 美联社
item.description:
Vladimir Putin’s guns are firing around five times as many shells as Ukraine’s are. But does Russia have enough artillery to keep it up? https://t.co/0N4l6HIRCW

item.title: 除了欧洲，其他地方都在向上、向高、向天空发展。了解为什么欧洲是被高楼建筑商遗忘的半岛 👇。
item.description:
Everywhere is building upwards, higher, further into the sky—except Europe. Read why it is the peninsula that tower-builders forgot https://t.co/N5AbPS7gES 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 新药可能会终结世界肥胖症的流行。必须仔细研究其长期影响--但兴奋是有道理的 👇
item.description:
New drugs could spell an end to the world’s obesity epidemic. The long-term effects must be carefully studied—but the excitement is justified https://t.co/euhBhJmVqM👇

item.title: 越南儿童的教育体系是世界上最好的教育体系之一。这对经济也有帮助👇。
item.description:
Vietnamese children go through one of the best schooling systems in the world. That has helped the economy too https://t.co/T6zhXstsCt 👇

item.title: 日本多年来一直保持超宽松的货币政策，现在开始追随其他经济体在普遍通胀出现后所设定的路线。这是一个非凡的时刻👇。
item.description:
Having kept monetary policy ultra-loose for years, Japan has now begun to follow the course set by other economies since widespread inflation took hold.

It is a remarkable moment https://t.co/euATH7O53M 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: "这些人不在乎美国梦，他们只在乎钱。"《1843》杂志讲述了美国最致命的人口走私企图背后的故事。

item.title: 詹姆斯-布拉德利（James Bradley）是在公路上长大的，当时美国卡车司机的形象还沉浸在边疆的神话中。这是一个蓝领卡车司机如何卷入美国最致命的人口走私企图的故事。
item.description:
James Bradley came of age on the road, when the figure of the American truck driver was steeped in the myth of the frontier.

This is the story of how a blue-collar trucker got involved in one of America’s deadliest people-smuggling attempts https://t.co/UWVxNJAfFz

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 雄心勃勃的女性尽可能地努力变瘦，这在经济上是合理的。这是一个悲剧👇。

item.title: 随着最近几周战斗的加剧，弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）的火炮发射的炮弹数量约为乌克兰的五倍。 👇
item.description:
